Articles.Content:
Hello, KSP Fans.

Today, i gonna present you the...

Swift Air Breathing Plane!

Yes. It is my first Random Space Plane. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Here are some Pictures:

![933bl.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/933bl.jpg)

Here you can see a Random Flight:

![7H8at.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/7H8at.jpg)

A Takeoff:

![iBrKM.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/iBrKM.jpg)

The sun is shining!

![EQtKT.jpg](http://i.imgur.com/EQtKT.jpg)

Well, this is the end of my new Space Ship Topic. (For now.. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif) )

Have some fun with it, -TheDownloaderG3y

(Add the .craft file to the ,,SPH,, folder!!!)
Sorry. I dont know why the Pictures aren\'t working. ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

You can\'t use your computer\'s filepath. You need to upload the images to an image hosting service like imgur or photobucket. Currently, you\'ve got [img\*][http://c/Users/](http://c/Users/)**[DATA EXPUNGED]**/Desktop/Random%20KSP/Screenshots/screenshot15.png[/img\*]. You need a url, like '[http://imgur.com/owQjs,'](http://imgur.com/owQjs,) not a computer filepath.
Imgur is what I use, it works perfectly and is extremely simple.

> 
> Imgur is what I use, it works perfectly and is extremely simple.

I concur. It\'s fast, reliable, and unlike photobucket, the photos don\'t get taken down after inactivity, which can be EXTREMELY frustrating.
Thank you guys. I will fix it now. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
